statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ 2 \\ 4 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ 4 \\ -3 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ -2 \\ -1 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -16 \\ 6 \\ -4 \\ -19 \end{array}\right] are or are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^4

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ 2 \\ 4 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ 4 \\ -3 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ -2 \\ -1 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -16 \\ 6 \\ -4 \\ -19 \end{array}\right] are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^4.
